sentences: Hän sanoi että meidät voidaan siirtää eri tiloihin ja sitoa eri tavoin.
context: The Finnish verb 'sitoa' means to tie, bind, or fasten something. It can refer to literally tying objects together with rope or string, or metaphorically binding people or things in some relationship or constraint. The word is often used when referring to securing animals, tying packages, or figuratively connecting elements.
